Key Match Events: Pete Alonso hit a three-run home run in the first inning
The Mets batted around and opened an 8-1 cushion in the third inning
Mookie Betts went deep for the second consecutive game, helping Los Angeles cut an eight-run deficit to 10-6
Post-Match Reflections: Francisco Lindor expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win
Miscellaneous Highlights: The sellout crowd of 43,841 chanted Pete Alonso's name when he batted in the eighth
Others: Sean Manaea is lined up to start Sunday for New York on five days' rest, while the Dodgers will go with another bullpen game because of a thin rotation decimated by injuries
